poem:
**Streaks of Standoff**

In chambers sworn to silence, shadows  
stretch beneath the dome;  
eleven echoes hold their breath,  
a nation in a combed-back fever,  
where ghostly votes drift restless,  
untouched by midnight clock hands;  
discord weeps its paper trail—  
ink-blotched promises,  
fervescent and frenetic  
in the unlit frenzy of waiting.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Republican senators indicate they won’t confirm Trump special counsel pick after ‘Nazi streak’ comments – US politics live 2.56pm BST In a short while, we’ll hear from House Republican lawmakers as the government shutdown enters day 21, one of the longest on record. There isn’t a vote scheduled in the Senate on the stopgap funding bill that has failed 11 times in the upper chamber. However, Senate majority leader John Thune told reporters on Monday". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Republican senators indicate they won’t confirm Trump special counsel pick after ‘Nazi streak’ comments – US politics live 2.56pm BST In a short while, we’ll hear from House Republican lawmakers as the government shutdown enters day 21, one of the longest on record. There isn’t a vote scheduled in the Senate on the stopgap funding bill that has failed 11 times in the upper chamber. However, Senate majority leader John Thune told reporters on Monday
